alert.note: Alert for Walthall (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 24 at 8:39PM CST until January 26 at 8:24PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Louisiana, including the following parishes, St. Tammany, Tangipahoa and Washington and southern Mississippi, including the following counties, Pearl River and Walthall. * WHEN...Until 930 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways from earlier flash flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 839 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hammond, Bogalusa, Covington, Franklinton, Abita Springs, Varnado, Folsom, Sun, Enon, Crossroads, Dexter, Robert, Natalbany and Angie. - This includes the follwing Interstate... Interstate 12 between mile markers 40 and 56. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
